citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
In May 2022 three male voles were left without water for a period of 1-3 days, leading to their deaths. On 13 May two of
the voles were found dead, and the third was humanely euthanized due to severe clinical signs. At the time of discovery,
the voles did not have a water bottle and no other source of water was available. The cage had been changed on 10 May
but the water bottle was not replaced. The lack of a water bottle was not noticed until the voles were found on 13 May.
Daily observations of all animals is essential to help ensure timely intervention of any health or husbandry problems.
Failure to provide oversight can result in severe impacts on animal health and welfare, including death. The facility must
ensure that all animals are adequately observed on at least a daily basis. Correct from this time forward

Stallion #3 had an excessive accumulation of waste and feces throughout his pen. This is a source of potential
contamination to the enclosed animal, and is also an attractant to pests and insects. The enclosure must be cleaned as
often as necessary to prevent contamination and protect the health of the animal.
Corrected at the time of inspection
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
End Section

narrative:
2.33(b)(3)  Critical
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care. 
In May 2022 three male voles were left without water for a period of 1-3 days, leading to their deaths. On 13 May two of 
the voles were found dead, and the third was humanely euthanized due to severe clinical signs. At the time of discovery, 
the voles did not have a water bottle and no other source of water was available. The cage had been changed on 10 May 
but the water bottle was not replaced. The lack of a water bottle was not noticed until the voles were found on 13 May. 
Daily observations of all animals is essential to help ensure timely intervention of any health or husbandry problems. 
Failure to provide oversight can result in severe impacts on animal health and welfare, including death.  The facility must 
ensure that all animals are adequately observed on at least a daily basis. Correct from this time forward 
3.131(a) 
   
Sanitation. 
Stallion #3 had an excessive accumulation of waste and feces throughout his pen.  This is a source of potential 
contamination to the enclosed animal, and is also an attractant to pests and insects.  The enclosure must be cleaned as 
often as necessary to prevent contamination and protect the health of the animal. 
Corrected at the time of inspection 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.

End Section
